section.name: Consulting for Architecture, Object and Component Technologie
section.p: I am an independent consultant for software architecture, OO analysis, design and implementation of business systems. I have written AndroMDA just to show my clients how easy and effective it can be to use a model-driven approach for large scale software development projects.
If you run a software development project and you should have the need for some independent view and vendor-neutral expertise, it may make sense to ask me for contract work.

I work as a peer for my clients' software development teams during day to day development work. Conference talks and the writing of books and magazine articles goes hand-in-hand with the other activities. Main subjects of my work are:

Each project is different. How a project looks like, depends on three variables: culture, architecture and process. They form a triangle - when you change one of them, the rest will change, too. Therefore, I try to see a project as a whole.

Consulting, coaching, training, mentoring - all these are ways to influence people to go into the direction "they always wanted to go but could not". In one project I use one way, in another project I use another. It depends on how the three variables are configured in that particular company.

p.b: Stop philosophy - kneel down and get your hands dirty!

section.p: You want to know more about me and my clients? You want to contact me? Maybe, you want to see what model-driven architecture can do for your project?

Visit my website at http://www.mbohlen.de/ - there you will find all the info you need. Most of the website is in German because I mainly work in Germany. However, you will find a link "English pages" on the upper left side to get an English overview.
